Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Refereeing activity for: Journal of Population Economics; Economics and Human Biology; The European Journal of Health Economics; IZA Journal of European Labor Studies; Labour; International Journal of Social Welfare

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Oral presention at Centre for Ageing Research and Development in Ireland (CARDI) conference
Oral Presentation at the Second TEMPO Conference on International Migration, Vienna, Austria
Oral presentation at Irish Economic Association Conference, Dublin, Ireland, 2012
Oral Presentations (sessions 141-2 and 180-1) at the Population Association of American Annual Conference, New Orleans, US
Oral Presentation at the Population Association of American Annual Conference, Boston US
Oral Presentation at the Irish Economy Conference: Learning from Crisis, Economic and Research institute, Dublin, Ireland, 2015
Oral Presentation at The Eighth Annual Irish Economics and Psychology Conference, Economic and Social Research Institute, Dublin, Ireland, 2015
Poster Presentation at Population Association of America (PAA) Conference, Washington, US

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Responsible for projects carried out on behalf on the Scottish Government while working as an Assistant Economist with DTZ Pieda Consulting, Edinburgh, UK

Co-author of the report "Fifty Plus in Ireland 2011: First Results from The Irish Longitudinal Study on Ageing", eds. Alan Barrett, George Savva, Virpi Timonen and Rose Anne Kenny. Dublin: Trinity College Dublin
Co-author of the report "The Over 50s in a Changing Ireland: Economic Circumstances, Health and Well-Being", eds. Anne Nolan, Claire O’Regan, Cara Dooley et al. Dublin: Trinity College Dublin
Co-author of the report "A New Look at the Recession and Ireland’s Older People: The Emigration of Adult Children and the Mental Health of their Parents". Dublin: Trinity College Dublin

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Research Affiliate, Economic and Social Research Institute, Dublin, Ireland
Awarded RAND Scholarship to Attend RAND Summer Institute on the Demography, Economics, Psychology, and Epidemiology of Aging, Santa Monica, California
Awarded Health and Research Board's Interdisciplinary Capacity Enhancement (ICE) award aimed at investigating issues relating to labour market and financial outcomes and mental health.
Reserach Affiliate, Institute for the Study of Labor (IZA), Bonn, Germany

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Attended a number of training courses, including: Policy Evaluation Metohds, CEMMAP, University College London (UCL), UK, in 2016; Panel/Longitudinal Data Analysis, CEMMAP, UCL, UK and Statistical Graphics with STATA, Trinity College Dublin in 2015; Econometrics of Cross Section/Panel Data, CEMMAP, UCL, UK in 2014 and Methods for the Analysis of Panel Data in Health, University of York, UK in 2012
Visiting researcher, Department of Economics, University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, UK
Visiting researcher, Munich Center for the Economics of Aging, Germany
Visiting Researcher, Norwegian Institute of Public Health, Oslo, Norway

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Teaching assistant of Basic Statistics for Finance, Intermediate Microeconomics and Introduction to Economics, Department of Economics, University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, UK
Post-doctoral researcher, The Irish Longitudinal Study on Ageing, Trinity College Dublin, Ireland
Research Fellow, The Irish Longitudinal Study on Ageing, Trinity College Dublin, Ireland
Guest Lecturer, Master in Social Policy, University College Dublin, Ireland
Tutor, Economics 101, Trinity Access Programme, Trinity College Dublin, Dublin, Ireland

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Represented The Irish Longitudinal Study on Ageing at 'Dataset Workshop' at Oxford Institute of Population Ageing, University of Oxford, with representatives of other international studies on ageing
Represented The Irish Longitudinal Study on Ageing at 'Wealth Imputation Workshop' at Munich Center for the Economics of Aging, Germany, with representatives of other international studies on ageing
Represented The Irish Longitudinal Study on Ageing at 'Workshop on Ageing', Norwegian Institute for Public Health, Oslo, Norway
Participated at Annual Meeting of 'British Isles Longitudinal Studies on Ageing'

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Contributed to funding application for Health and Research Board Interdisciplinary Capacity Enhancement Award 2011/07 to ‘Examine Inequalities in Mental Health with TILDA’. Fundings awarded: €794,680
Co-applicant of Centre for Ageing Research and Development in Ireland Grant to ‘Examine Inequalities in Health and Health Behaviours’. Fundings awarded: €16,000

Contributed to funding application for Health and Research board Knowledge Exchange and Dissemination Scheme to ‘Promote Positive Mental Health Messages for the Older Population’. Fundings awarded: €60,000
